qa_pairs.question: What types of businesses does JA Assure cover?
qa_pairs.answer: JA Assure covers: Jewellery Retailers, Jewellery & Gold Manufacturers, Jewellery & Gold Bullion Distributors, Diamond Dealers, Money Changers, Remittance Services, Luxury Good Retailers, Luxury Watch Retailers, Pawnbrokers, and Precious Stones Dealers.

qa_pairs.question: What security features are assessed in proposals?
qa_pairs.answer: JA Assure assesses: CCTV systems, alarm systems, door access controls, safes and strong rooms, display showcase protection, transit security, guard arrangements, and central monitoring stations.

qa_pairs.question: What is a proposal form?
qa_pairs.answer: A proposal form is an insurance application document submitted by a business seeking coverage. It contains details about the business profile, physical setup, security measures, claim history, and coverage requirements.

qa_pairs.question: How are claims handled?
qa_pairs.answer: Claims are processed based on the claim history recorded in each proposal. Proposals are categorized as either having no claims within 3 years or having claims within the past 3 years.

qa_pairs.question: What is transit coverage?
qa_pairs.answer: Transit coverage protects goods during transportation. Proposals assess whether businesses use armoured vehicles, Jaguar transit services, armed guards during transit, and GPS trackers in vehicles and bags.

qa_pairs.question: What safe grades are recognized?
qa_pairs.answer: Safe grades range from Ungraded to Grade VII. Higher grades indicate stronger security. Proposals also track whether safes have time-locking features and certification.

qa_pairs.question: What CCTV features are tracked?
qa_pairs.answer: CCTV assessment includes: recording capability, number of cameras, brand and model, backup type (real-time remote, on-site, periodic), maintenance contracts, additional capabilities (motion detection, night vision), and retention period.

qa_pairs.question: What premise types are covered?
qa_pairs.answer: Covered premise types include: Office buildings, Shopping centres, Shop houses, and Others. Physical setup assessment also covers roof, wall, and floor materials.
